objective: Test and validate the fully optimized coordinator (Generation 20) across all four hypothesis implementations

focus_areas: Health Check Probe (Hypothesis 1) - 15s early failure detection
Streaming Output (Hypothesis 4) - Real-time visibility with heartbeat
test_scenarios: Simple task: Basic read/write operation (expect simple/60s timeout)
Moderate task: File analysis with context (expect moderate/120s timeout)
Complex task: Multi-step research and implementation (expect complex/180s timeout)
Health check recovery: Verify lazy context does not trigger false negatives
metrics_to_collect: Health check: pass/fail counts, execution time
Context loading: lazy vs full mode usage, context efficiency %
Timeout: extension count, early terminations, waste reduction %
Heartbeat: silence warnings, output bursts, startup latency ms
Overall: Per-task completion time, output bytes, resource efficiency

expected_improvements.timeout_management: 40% reduction in timeout waste through activity detection
expected_improvements.output_visibility: Real-time progress with 45s silence warnings and 90s heartbeat timeout

requirements: Deploy coordinator with all four optimizations enabled (env vars as defaults)
Run coordinator for at least 3 test cycles with varying task complexity levels
Enable all logging: LOG_HEALTH_CHECK=true, LOG_PROGRESS=true, LOG_AGENT_OUTPUT=true
Collect metrics from .swarm/results/{requestId}.json for each spawned agent
Compare completion times and timeout effectiveness vs baseline (Gen 20)
Document any failures, edge cases, or configuration issues discovered
Validate that lazy context mode does not cause instruction truncation
Generate summary report with measured improvements (no fabricated scores)
